trans-unit.source: Reliable Actors Diagnostics and Performance Monitoring
trans-unit.target: Reliable Actors Diagnostics and Performance Monitoring

trans-unit.source: This article describes the diagnostics and performance monitoring features in the Reliable Actors runtime, including the events and performance counters emitted by it.
trans-unit.target: This article describes the diagnostics and performance monitoring features in the Reliable Actors runtime, including the events and performance counters emitted by it.

trans-unit.source: Reliable Actors runtime emits <linkText>EventSource</linkText><title></title> events and <linkText>performance counters</linkText><title></title> that provide insights into how the runtime is operating and help with troubleshooting and performance monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Reliable Actors runtime emits <linkText>EventSource</linkText><title></title> events and <linkText>performance counters</linkText><title></title> that provide insights into how the runtime is operating and help with troubleshooting and performance monitoring.

trans-unit.source: The EventSource name for Reliable Actors runtime is "Microsoft-ServiceFabric-Actors".
trans-unit.target: The EventSource name for Reliable Actors runtime is "Microsoft-ServiceFabric-Actors".

trans-unit.source: Events from this event source appear in the <linkText>Diagnostics Events</linkText><title></title> window when the actor application is being <linkText>debugged in Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Events from this event source appear in the <linkText>Diagnostics Events</linkText><title></title> window when the actor application is being <linkText>debugged in Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric also offers the option of directing these events to <linkText>Application Insights</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric also offers the option of directing these events to <linkText>Application Insights</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more information on this, please see the article on <linkText>Application Insights setup for Service Fabric</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on this, please see the article on <linkText>Application Insights setup for Service Fabric</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Other examples of tools and technologies that help in collecting and/or viewing EventSource events are <linkText>PerfView</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Azure Diagnostics</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Semantic Logging</linkText><title></title> and the <linkText>Microsoft TraceEvent Library</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Other examples of tools and technologies that help in collecting and/or viewing EventSource events are <linkText>PerfView</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Azure Diagnostics</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Semantic Logging</linkText><title></title> and the <linkText>Microsoft TraceEvent Library</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: All events that belong to the Reliable Actors EventSource are associated with one or more keywords.
trans-unit.target: All events that belong to the Reliable Actors EventSource are associated with one or more keywords.

trans-unit.source: This enables filtering of events that are collected.
trans-unit.target: This enables filtering of events that are collected.

trans-unit.source: The following keywords bits are defined:
trans-unit.target: The following keywords bits are defined:

trans-unit.source: Set of important events that summarize the operation of the Fabric Actors runtime
trans-unit.target: Set of important events that summarize the operation of the Fabric Actors runtime

trans-unit.source: Set of events describing actor method calls.
trans-unit.target: Set of events describing actor method calls.

trans-unit.source: For more information, please see the <linkText>introductory topic on actors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, please see the <linkText>introductory topic on actors</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Set of events related to actor state.
trans-unit.target: Set of events related to actor state.

trans-unit.source: For more information, please see the topic on <linkText>stateful actors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, please see the topic on <linkText>stateful actors</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Set of events related to turn-based concurrency in the actor.
trans-unit.target: Set of events related to turn-based concurrency in the actor.

trans-unit.source: For more information, please see the topic on <linkText>concurrency</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, please see the topic on <linkText>concurrency</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime defines the following performance counter categories.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime defines the following performance counter categories.

trans-unit.source: Counters specific to Service Fabric actors.
trans-unit.target: Counters specific to Service Fabric actors.

trans-unit.source: e.g. time taken to save actor state.
trans-unit.target: e.g. time taken to save actor state.

trans-unit.source: Counters specific to methods implemented by Service Fabric actors.
trans-unit.target: Counters specific to methods implemented by Service Fabric actors.

trans-unit.source: e.g. how often an actor method is invoked.
trans-unit.target: e.g. how often an actor method is invoked.

trans-unit.source: Each of the above categories has one or more counters.
trans-unit.target: Each of the above categories has one or more counters.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>Windows Performance Monitor</linkText><title></title> application that is available by default in the Windows operating system can be used to collect and view performance counter data.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>Windows Performance Monitor</linkText><title></title> application that is available by default in the Windows operating system can be used to collect and view performance counter data.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Diagnostics</linkText><title></title> is another option for collecting performance counter data and uploading it to Azure tables.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Diagnostics</linkText><title></title> is another option for collecting performance counter data and uploading it to Azure tables.

trans-unit.source: A cluster with a large number of actor services or actor service partitions will have a large number of actor performance counter instances.
trans-unit.target: A cluster with a large number of actor services or actor service partitions will have a large number of actor performance counter instances.

trans-unit.source: The performance counter instances names can help in identifying the specific <linkText>partition</linkText><title></title> and actor method (if applicable) that the performance counter instance is associated with.
trans-unit.target: The performance counter instances names can help in identifying the specific <linkText>partition</linkText><title></title> and actor method (if applicable) that the performance counter instance is associated with.

trans-unit.source: For the category Service Fabric Actor, the counter instance names are in the following format:
trans-unit.target: For the category Service Fabric Actor, the counter instance names are in the following format:

trans-unit.source: ServiceFabricPartitionID - is the string representation of the Service Fabric partition ID that the performance counter instance is associated with.
trans-unit.target: ServiceFabricPartitionID - is the string representation of the Service Fabric partition ID that the performance counter instance is associated with.

trans-unit.source: The partition ID is a GUID and its string representation is generated using the [Guid.ToString](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/97af8hh4.aspx) method with format specifier "D".
trans-unit.target: The partition ID is a GUID and its string representation is generated using the [Guid.ToString](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/97af8hh4.aspx) method with format specifier "D".

trans-unit.source: ActorRuntimeInternalID - is the string representation of a 64-bit integer that is generated by the Fabric Actors runtime for its internal use.
trans-unit.target: ActorRuntimeInternalID - is the string representation of a 64-bit integer that is generated by the Fabric Actors runtime for its internal use.

trans-unit.source: This is included in the performance counter instance name to ensure its uniqueness and avoid conflict with other performance counter instance names.
trans-unit.target: This is included in the performance counter instance name to ensure its uniqueness and avoid conflict with other performance counter instance names.

trans-unit.source: Users should not try to interpret this portion of the performance counter instance name.
trans-unit.target: Users should not try to interpret this portion of the performance counter instance name.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of a counter instance name for a counter belonging to the 'Service Fabric Actor' category:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of a counter instance name for a counter belonging to the 'Service Fabric Actor' category:

trans-unit.source: In the example above, 2740af29-78aa-44bc-a20b-7e60fb783264 is the string representation of the Service Fabric partition ID and 635650083799324046 is the 64-bit ID that is generated for the runtime's internal use.
trans-unit.target: In the example above, 2740af29-78aa-44bc-a20b-7e60fb783264 is the string representation of the Service Fabric partition ID and 635650083799324046 is the 64-bit ID that is generated for the runtime's internal use.

trans-unit.source: For the category Service Fabric Actor Method, the counter instance names are in the following format:
trans-unit.target: For the category Service Fabric Actor Method, the counter instance names are in the following format:

trans-unit.source: MethodName - is the name of the actor method that the performance counter instance is associated with.
trans-unit.target: MethodName - is the name of the actor method that the performance counter instance is associated with.

trans-unit.source: The format of the method name is determined based on some logic in the Fabric Actors runtime that balances the readability of the name with constraints on the maximum length of the performance counter instance names on Windows.
trans-unit.target: The format of the method name is determined based on some logic in the Fabric Actors runtime that balances the readability of the name with constraints on the maximum length of the performance counter instance names on Windows.

trans-unit.source: ActorsRuntimeMethodId - is the string representation of a 32-bit integer that is generated by the Fabric Actors runtime for its internal use.
trans-unit.target: ActorsRuntimeMethodId - is the string representation of a 32-bit integer that is generated by the Fabric Actors runtime for its internal use.

trans-unit.source: This is included in the performance counter instance name to ensure its uniqueness and avoid conflict with other performance counter instance names.
trans-unit.target: This is included in the performance counter instance name to ensure its uniqueness and avoid conflict with other performance counter instance names.

trans-unit.source: Users should not try to interpret this portion of the performance counter instance name.
trans-unit.target: Users should not try to interpret this portion of the performance counter instance name.

trans-unit.source: ServiceFabricPartitionID - is the string representation of the Service Fabric partition ID that the performance counter instance is associated with.
trans-unit.target: ServiceFabricPartitionID - is the string representation of the Service Fabric partition ID that the performance counter instance is associated with.

trans-unit.source: The partition ID is a GUID and its string representation is generated using the [Guid.ToString](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/97af8hh4.aspx) method with format specifier "D".
trans-unit.target: The partition ID is a GUID and its string representation is generated using the [Guid.ToString](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/97af8hh4.aspx) method with format specifier "D".

trans-unit.source: ActorRuntimeInternalID - is the string representation of a 64-bit integer that is generated by the Fabric Actors runtime for its internal use.
trans-unit.target: ActorRuntimeInternalID - is the string representation of a 64-bit integer that is generated by the Fabric Actors runtime for its internal use.

trans-unit.source: This is included in the performance counter instance name to ensure its uniqueness and avoid conflict with other performance counter instance names.
trans-unit.target: This is included in the performance counter instance name to ensure its uniqueness and avoid conflict with other performance counter instance names.

trans-unit.source: Users should not try to interpret this portion of the performance counter instance name.
trans-unit.target: Users should not try to interpret this portion of the performance counter instance name.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of a counter instance name for a counter belonging to the 'Service Fabric Actor Method' category:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of a counter instance name for a counter belonging to the 'Service Fabric Actor Method' category:

trans-unit.source: In the example above, ivoicemailboxactor.leavemessageasync is the method name, 2 is the 32-bit ID generated for the runtime's internal use, 89383d32-e57e-4a9b-a6ad-57c6792aa521 is the string representation of the Service Fabric partition ID and 635650083804480486 is the 64-bit ID generated for the runtime's internal use.
trans-unit.target: In the example above, ivoicemailboxactor.leavemessageasync is the method name, 2 is the 32-bit ID generated for the runtime's internal use, 89383d32-e57e-4a9b-a6ad-57c6792aa521 is the string representation of the Service Fabric partition ID and 635650083804480486 is the 64-bit ID generated for the runtime's internal use.

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>actor methods</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>actor methods</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Actors runtime is about to invoke an actor method
trans-unit.target: Actors runtime is about to invoke an actor method

trans-unit.source: An actor method has finished executing, i.e. the runtime's asynchronous call to the actor method has returned and the Task returned by the actor method has completed.
trans-unit.target: An actor method has finished executing, i.e. the runtime's asynchronous call to the actor method has returned and the Task returned by the actor method has completed.

trans-unit.source: An exception was thrown during the execution of an actor method, either during the runtime's asynchronous call to the actor method or during the execution of the Task returned by the actor method.
trans-unit.target: An exception was thrown during the execution of an actor method, either during the runtime's asynchronous call to the actor method or during the execution of the Task returned by the actor method.

trans-unit.source: This event indicates some sort of failure in the actor code that needs investigation.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates some sort of failure in the actor code that needs investigation.

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime publishes the following performance counters related to the execution of actor methods.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime publishes the following performance counters related to the execution of actor methods.

trans-unit.source: Number of times the actor service method is invoked per second
trans-unit.target: Number of times the actor service method is invoked per second

trans-unit.source: Time taken to execute the actor service method in milliseconds
trans-unit.target: Time taken to execute the actor service method in milliseconds

trans-unit.source: Number of times the actor service method threw an exception per second
trans-unit.target: Number of times the actor service method threw an exception per second

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>concurrency</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>concurrency</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This event is written at the start of each new turn in an actor.
trans-unit.target: This event is written at the start of each new turn in an actor.

trans-unit.source: It contains the number of pending actor calls waiting to acquire the per-actor lock that enforces turn-based concurrency.
trans-unit.target: It contains the number of pending actor calls waiting to acquire the per-actor lock that enforces turn-based concurrency.

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime publishes the following performance counters related to concurrency.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime publishes the following performance counters related to concurrency.

trans-unit.source: # of actor calls waiting for actor lock
trans-unit.target: # of actor calls waiting for actor lock

trans-unit.source: Number of pending actor calls waiting to acquire the per-actor lock that enforces turn-based concurrency.
trans-unit.target: Number of pending actor calls waiting to acquire the per-actor lock that enforces turn-based concurrency.

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>actor state management</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>actor state management</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Actors runtime is about to save actor state.
trans-unit.target: Actors runtime is about to save actor state.

trans-unit.source: Actors runtime has finished saving actor state.
trans-unit.target: Actors runtime has finished saving actor state.

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime publishes the following performance counters related to actor state management.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime publishes the following performance counters related to actor state management.

trans-unit.source: Average milliseconds per save state operation
trans-unit.target: Average milliseconds per save state operation

trans-unit.source: Time taken to save actor state in milliseconds
trans-unit.target: Time taken to save actor state in milliseconds

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>stateless actor instances</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>stateless actor instances</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This implies that the actors for this partition can be created inside this instance (and possibly other instances too).
trans-unit.target: This implies that the actors for this partition can be created inside this instance (and possibly other instances too).

trans-unit.source: This implies that the actors for this partition will no longer be created inside this instance.
trans-unit.target: This implies that the actors for this partition will no longer be created inside this instance.

trans-unit.source: No new requests will be delivered to actors already created within this instance.
trans-unit.target: No new requests will be delivered to actors already created within this instance.

trans-unit.source: The actors will be destroyed after any in-progress requests are completed.
trans-unit.target: The actors will be destroyed after any in-progress requests are completed.

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>stateful actor replicas</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>stateful actor replicas</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Stateful actor replica changed role to Primary.
trans-unit.target: Stateful actor replica changed role to Primary.

trans-unit.source: This implies that the actors for this partition will be created inside this replica.
trans-unit.target: This implies that the actors for this partition will be created inside this replica.

trans-unit.source: Stateful actor replica changed role to non-Primary.
trans-unit.target: Stateful actor replica changed role to non-Primary.

trans-unit.source: This implies that the actors for this partition will no longer be created inside this replica.
trans-unit.target: This implies that the actors for this partition will no longer be created inside this replica.

trans-unit.source: No new requests will be delivered to actors already created within this replica.
trans-unit.target: No new requests will be delivered to actors already created within this replica.

trans-unit.source: The actors will be destroyed after any in-progress requests are completed.
trans-unit.target: The actors will be destroyed after any in-progress requests are completed.

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>actor activation and deactivation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Actors runtime emits the following events related to <linkText>actor activation and deactivation</linkText><title></title>.
